required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transoral Robotic Surgery (TORS) for Oral and Laryngopharyngeal Lesions Using Da Vinci Robotic Surgical System
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study Assessing Transoral Robotic Surgery (TORS) for Oral and Laryngopharyngeal Benign and Malignant Lesions Using the Da Vinci Robotic Surgical System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to conduct a pilot single-arm to assess transoral robotic surgery (TORS) for oral and laryngopharyngeal benign and malignant lesions using the Da Vinci Robotic Surgical System.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients are going to be evaluated in their usual regular clinical follow ups starting with preoperative first visit, 3 weeks, 3 months and 6 months postoperatively with a Quality of Life survey (Head and Neck Cancer Inventory, HNCI-QOLQ).

primary_outcome.measure: The Number and Percent of All Evaluable Patients Who Have Successfully Undergone TORS at Each Interim Analysis.
primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of surgery, lasting up to 3 hours. Assessed for up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: In order to evaluate the feasibility of TORS, the investigators will report the number and percent of all evaluable patients who have successfully undergone TORS at each interim analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of surgery, up to 3 hours
secondary_outcome.description: The total operative times include the induction of and emergence from anesthesia, the TORS procedure, plus any adjunct procedures (eg, neck dissections) performed during the same operation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Blood Loss and Complications
Average Time to Set up and Perform Procedures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of surgery, up to 3 hours
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome is to identify the learning curve for TORS by measuring the efficiency of the surgeon who performs the procedures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Correctly Predicted Success of TORS Preoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome is to identify the learning curve for TORS by measuring the accuracy of the surgeon who performs the procedures.
Quality of life (QOL) of the patients undergoing TORS will be measures. The score range is 0-100 with higher scores denoting better outcome.

arm_group.description: Transoral Robotic Surgery (TORS) using the Da Vinci Robotic Surgical System

intervention.intervention_name: Da Vinci Robotic Transoral Robotic Surgical System
intervention.description: (TORS) Da Vinci Robotic Transoral Robotic Surgical System
intervention.other_name: (TORS) Da Vinci Robotic Transoral Robotic Surgical System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient must present with indications for diagnostic or therapeutic approaches for benign and malignant diseases of the oral cavity or laryngopharynx (including the neoplastic lesions of the tongue, tongue base, retromolar trigone, tonsils, palate, posterior and lateral pharynx, glottic, supraglottic and subglottic larynx)
- Patients must have adequate transoral exposure of the oral cavity and laryngopharynx for TORS instrumentation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unexplained fever and/or untreated, active infection
- Patient pregnancy
- Previous head and neck surgery precluding transoral/robotic procedures
- The presence of medical conditions contraindicating general anesthesia or transoral surgical approaches

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
